com.raspoid

Class I2CComponent

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.raspoid.I2CComponent
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Component
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    MPU6050

    public class I2CComponent
extends java.lang.Object
implements Component
    This class is used as an abstraction for each i2c component of the framework. This povides usefull utilities to connect to, read data from and write data to i2c devices.

    • Field Detail

      • MAX_I2C_ADDRESS

        public static final int MAX_I2C_ADDRESS
        The maximum available i2c device address is 0x77.

        A seven bit wide address space theoretically allows 128 I2C addresses. However, some addresses are reserved for special purposes. Only 112 addresses are then available with the 7 bit address scheme.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • MIN_I2C_ADDRESS

        public static final int MIN_I2C_ADDRESS
        The minimum available i2c device address is 0x03.

        A seven bit wide address space theoretically allows 128 I2C addresses. However, some addresses are reserved for special purposes. Thus, only 112 addresses are available with the 7 bit address scheme.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • device

        protected com.pi4j.io.i2c.I2CDevice device
        The abstraction of the i2c device. It allows data to be read or written to the device.

             throws com.pi4j.io.i2c.I2CFactory.UnsupportedBusNumberException
        Constructor for a new i2c component, connected on the bus at the specific i2cAddress.
        Parameters:
        i2cAddress - the i2c device address of the corresponding component.
        Throws:
        com.pi4j.io.i2c.I2CFactory.UnsupportedBusNumberException

    • Method Detail

      • getDevice

        public com.pi4j.io.i2c.I2CDevice getDevice()
        Get the abstraction of the i2c device. It then allows data to be read or written to the device.
        Returns:
        the abstraction of the i2c device.
        See Also:
        I2CDevice

      • writeUnsignedValueDirectlyToI2CDevice

        public void writeUnsignedValueDirectlyToI2CDevice(int value)
        This method writes an unsigned value directly on the i2c device (not on a specific register on this device).
        Parameters:
        value - the unsigned value to be written on the device. This value must be in the 0..255 interval.
        See Also:
        I2CDevice.write(byte)

      • writeUnsignedValueToRegister

        public void writeUnsignedValueToRegister(int reg,
                                         int value)
        This method writes an unsigned value on the i2c device, on a specific register of this device.
        Parameters:
        reg - the destination register on the i2c device.
        value - the unsigned value to be written on the device. This value must be in the 0..255 interval.
        See Also:
        I2CDevice.write(int, byte)

      • readUnsignedRegisterValue

        public int readUnsignedRegisterValue(int reg)
        Reads the content of the reg register (8bits), and returns this value in the 0..255 interval if read operation was successfull. A negative number is returned for an error.
        Parameters:
        reg - the local address on the i2c device where the data must be read.
        Returns:
        the byte value read on the device: a positive number in the 0..255 interval if reading was successful; a negative number (<0) if reading failed.
        See Also:
        I2CDevice.read(int), readSignedRegisterValue(int)

      • readSignedRegisterValue

        public int readSignedRegisterValue(int reg)
        Reads the content of the reg register (8bits), and returns the signed integer representation of this value in the -128..127 interval if read operation was successfull. A negative number under -128 is returned for an error.
        Parameters:
        reg - the local address on the i2c device where the data must be read.
        Returns:
        the integer signed representation of the byte value read on the device: a positive number in the -128..127 interval if reading was successful; a negative number (<128) if reading failed.
        See Also:
        readUnsignedRegisterValue(int)

      • readTwoUnsignedRegisters

        public int readTwoUnsignedRegisters(int reg)
        Reads the unsigned content of two consecutive registers (reg and reg + 1) (16bits), and returns the big endian combination of those values.
        Parameters:
        reg - the local address on the i2c device of the first register to be read.
        Returns:
        the unsigned big endian combination of the reads of registers reg and reg + 1 on the i2c device.
        See Also:
        readUnsignedRegisterValue(int)

      • readTwoSignedRegsiters

        public int readTwoSignedRegsiters(int reg)
        Reads the signed content of two consecutive registers (reg and reg + 1) (16bits), and returns the big endian combination of those values.
        Parameters:
        reg - the local address on the i2c device of the first register to be read.
        Returns:
        the signed big endian combination of the reads of registers reg and reg + 1 on the i2c device.
        See Also:
        readUnsignedRegisterValue(int), readSignedRegisterValue(int)
